name: Terra Magica
caption:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spell-casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
info:
Draw an academy sigil that increases the <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage inflicted</font> by anyone standing within by 22.5% for 30 seconds (15% in PvP). The buff applies to magic damage from any source, only registers when damage resolves while you remain in the radius, lingers for 1.5 seconds after you exit, and immediately re-applies when you re-enter the sigil.

<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Glintstone

name: Glintblade Phalanx
caption:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Bestowed upon the enchanted Carian knights, who combined this art with their swordsmanship to maintain pressure upon their foes, striking in waves of steel and sorcery.
info:
Conjure a defensive arc of five glintblades overhead that automatically fire at nearby foes, tracking invisible enemies and chipping away at their stance while the blades shatter if they strike walls or ceilings. Charging increases the delay before the blades release, and the spell can be cast while moving or riding; the Carian Glintblade Staff adds 15% damage while the Godfrey Icon boosts charged damage by 15%.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (each glintblade):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.60
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (five glintblades):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 3.00
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Carian, Glintblade

name: Thops's Barrier
caption:
The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.

Future generations will learn. They will know the foolishness of the sneering sorcerers who ridiculed this theory, little realizing that it was in fact a discovery worthy of a new conspectus of the academy.
info:
Raise your shield to conjure a magical forcefield that deflects sorceries and incantations while functioning like a regular parry and costing no FP. This Ash of War has 3 start-up frames and 5 parry frames at 30 FPS (double both values at 60 FPS), so consult the parrying guide for recovery comparisons.

<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Glintstone

name: Miriam's Vanishing
caption:
Sorcery of a preceptor who served the Carian royal family.

The curator of the study hall was such a master of this sorcery that it now bears her name.
info:
Step into a glintstone haze that conceals you briefly before reappearing at a nearby location dictated by the directional input held before casting; without input you return to the same spot, and the spell cannot carry you downward if you try to teleport while descending. Miriam's Vanishing has 15 startup frames and grants 28 invulnerability frames (16 in PvP) at 30 FPS, the last 16 of which let you begin another cast even though inputs made before reappearing are not queued, and it incurs about a 1.7 second delay between casts, cannot be charged or used on horseback, and costs 9 FP.

<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Carian

name: Glintblade Trio
caption:
An old sorcery of the Carian royal family.

The prototypical form of sword-phalanx sorceries saw a different subsequent refinement in the realm of shadow.
info:
Create a sigil overhead that releases three enemy-seeking glintblades after a short delay; charging lengthens the delay and increases damage, and a charged cast can be followed immediately by an uncharged volley so both strike together while the sorcery can be used while moving or riding. Carian Glintblade Staff boosts its damage by 15%, and the Godfrey Icon increases the charged damage by 15%.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (per glintblade):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 1.09
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (per glintblade, charged):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 1.27
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (per glintblade):</font> 4
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (per glintblade, charged):</font> 6
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Carian, Glintblade

name: Rellana's Twin Moons
caption:
Sorcery of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight.

Associated with a Carian princess.
In her childhood, she and her elder sister Rennala met these moons. Overlapping, as though nestled against one another.
info:
Incarnate overlapping twin moons that crash into the ground in succession, unleashing moonlight shockwaves that shake the earth while keeping the caster stationary and immune to grab attacks during the moon transformation; the spell cannot be charged and cannot be cast on horseback.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (moon):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 3.00
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (final strike):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 4.00
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (per hit):</font> 10 (30 total)
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Carian

name: Glintstone Nail
caption:
Glintstone sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the finger sorceries said to have been discovered in a hallowed ruin.

Count Ymir boasts that this is mere child's play, an echo of a greater truth.
info:
Fire a heavy glintstone nail that crumbles in flight, striking foes with the projectile before bursting into shards that deal lingering <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage</font>; the nail travels more slowly than common glintstone projectiles but tracks better over medium-to-long range, and charging increases damage and stance pressure while the sorcery can be cast on horseback.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (projectile):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.16 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 2.69 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (projectile):</font> 3 uncharged / 5 charged
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Finger

name: Glintstone Nails
caption:
Glintstone sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the finger sorceries said to have been discovered in a hallowed ruin.

Count Ymir boasts that this is mere child's play, an echo of a greater truth.
info:
Launch six tracking magic nails that crumble on impact after a medium flight, traveling slightly slower so the projectiles can home in on distant targets over medium range; charging increases each nail's damage and stance pressure while the sorcery can be cast on horseback.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (each nail):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.66 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.75 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (each nail):</font> 2 uncharged / 4 charged
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Finger

name: Blades of Stone
caption:
Gravity-manipulating sorcery of Commander Gaius.

Gaius and Radahn were good rivals in their youth, and this sorcery is a product of their friendly competition.
info:
Rip blade-like clumps of rock from the earth, creating eruptions beneath foes that extend farther and spawn two extra blasts below the target when charged; this sorcery can easily miss enemies rushing toward you and cannot be cast while riding.

<font color="#F395C4">Base standard damage (uncharged):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.61
<font color="#F395C4">Base standard damage (charged):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 3.02
<font color="#F395C4">Base standard damage (additional eruption, charged):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 1.85 each
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (per eruption):</font> 8 (24 total when fully charged)
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Gravity

name: Gravitational Missile
caption:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Said to have originated in the lightless dark far beyond-the home of the fallingstar beasts.
info:
Fire a gravitational orb that tugs enemies twice toward it before exploding; the pulses have moderate stagger but a delay that weakens them versus high-<font color="#E0B985">poise</font> or evasive foes, cover a 5 meter radius (5.5 meters when charged), and culminate in a 6 meter explosion. Charging extends the range, adds a third pulse, and expands the pulse radius, while casting it at the ground causes the orb to detonate immediately without pulses; the sorcery cannot be used on horseback.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (explosion):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.79 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.38 charged
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (pulse):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.30 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.40 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (pulse):</font> 3 each (2 pulses uncharged / 3 charged)
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (explosion):</font> 10
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Gravity

name: Mantle of Thorns
caption:
Sorcery of those who abandoned the practice of incantations after devout faith rewarded them with only despair.

The image of the misshapen Scadutree is an edict:
Spurn all that exists. Wound all that exists.
For we have been abandoned.
info:
Spend 50 HP and cause 25 <font color="#C84343">blood loss accumulation</font> on yourself to coat the body in Scadutree thorns for 30 seconds (39 seconds with Old Lord's Talisman), adding damage to dodge rolls and wounding foes on contact while the thorns remain. Cannot be charged or cast on horseback, and even Alberich's Set or the Staff of the Guilty fail to boost the damage.

<font color="#C84343">Blood Loss:</font> Inflicts damage equal to 15% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 100.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage (dodge roll):</font> 87
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Thorn

name: Impenetrable Thorns
caption:
Sorcery of those who abandoned the practice of incantations after devout faith rewarded them with only despair.

The image of the twisted Scadutree is an edict:
Denounce their ways. Do them harm.
For they have abandoned us.
info:
Spend 50 HP and cause 25 <font color="#C84343">blood loss accumulation</font> on yourself to unleash three thorn trails from the earth that track enemies at medium-to-long range, each trail striking three times before fading. Bleed buildup is increased by Arcane-scaling staves such as the Albinauric Staff or the Maternal Staff, while Alberich's Set and the Staff of the Guilty (including another copy wielded in the offhand) boost the damage; the spell cannot be charged or cast on horseback.

<font color="#C84343">Blood Loss:</font> Inflicts damage equal to 15% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 100.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (per hit):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.63
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (per hit):</font> 1.67
<font color="#C84343">Base blood loss accumulation (per hit):</font> 17 (up to 153 per cast)
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Thorn

name: Rings of Spectral Light
caption: Sorcery practiced by the keepers of the spiritgraves, where all death ultimately drifts.
info:
Conjure six lemniscate rings that fire together after a short delay, dealing ghostflame magic over very long distance without causing stagger while inflicting frostbite; the cast costs 21 stamina (27 charged) and can be performed on horseback.

<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite:</font> Inflicts damage equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30, then increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 20% for 30 seconds.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (ring):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.53 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.63 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (ring):</font> 1 uncharged / 1.5 charged
<font color="#9DD7FB">Base frostbite accumulation:</font> 19 per hit (up to 114)
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Death

name: Vortex of Putrescence
caption:
Sorcery used by the Putrescent Knight.

In an age long past, Death was burned by ghostflame. Even the remains of tainted flesh were given equal treatment in death.
info:
Release a whirl of putrescent jets that combust on impact and send ghostflame trails back toward you, delivering a single strike that knocks enemies down with short stagger; the cast costs 45 stamina, cannot be charged, and can be performed on horseback. Not boosted by the Prince of Death's Staff.

<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite:</font> Inflicts damage equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30, then increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 20% for 30 seconds.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (impact):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 3.28
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage:</font> 5
<font color="#9DD7FB">Base frostbite accumulation:</font> 170
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Death

name: Mass of Putrescence
caption:
Sorcery originating from the putrid liquor of the stone coffins.

In an age long past, Death was burned by ghostflame. Even the remains of tainted flesh were given equal treatment in death.
info:
Heave a putrescent mass that pierces foes before exploding in ghostflame, best aimed at a surface because the projectile passes through enemies; charging greatly increases the ghostflame area of effect while sharing a long casting animation (about 1.8 seconds uncharged, 3 seconds charged) with Cannon of Haima. Costs 42 stamina uncharged (55 charged), can be cast while riding, and is not boosted by the Prince of Death's Staff.

<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite:</font> Inflicts damage equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30, then increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 20% for 30 seconds.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (mass):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 0.80 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 1.00 charged
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (ghostflame):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.00 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.00 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (mass):</font> 5
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (ghostflame):</font> 7 uncharged / 13 charged
<font color="#9DD7FB">Base frostbite accumulation (mass):</font> 40 uncharged / 50 charged
<font color="#9DD7FB">Base frostbite accumulation (ghostflame):</font> 120 uncharged / 150 charged
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Death

name: Fleeting Microcosm
caption:
A finger sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the secret hallowed rites.

The broken and discarded are fully willing to cling to fleeting simulacra, earning them some modicum of sympathy.
info:
Conjure a microcosm at a foe's feet that pulses once before bursting to knock enemies down. Has moderate range, cannot bypass walls even when cast below the target, and charging increases damage and blast radius (pulse radius about 3 meters; burst radius 4.5 meters uncharged or 6 meters charged). Cannot be cast while riding.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (pulse):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 1.20 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 1.60 charged
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage (burst):</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.14 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 2.71 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (pulse):</font> 7
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage (burst):</font> 7 uncharged / 11 charged
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Finger

name: Cherishing Fingers
caption:
A finger sorcery of Count Ymir, aspiring mother of fingers.

The dear fingers look after their mother, or perhaps that is merely what the mother wishes to believe.
info:
Surround the caster with a circle of hefty fingers that repel projectiles before erupting to stagger or knock foes away in a 2.8 meter radius (3.2 meters when charged), even if interrupted before they burst. It staggers hit enemies, charging knocks them away, and the fingers continue to ward off magic and physical projectiles before vanishing. Cannot be cast while riding.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage:</font> Sorcery Scaling x 2.53 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.47 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Base stance damage:</font> 11 uncharged / 15 charged
<font color="#E0B985">Category:</font> Finger
